message.content:
1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should display a testimonials carousel that allows users to view multiple testimonials via sliding or pagination. Each testimonial can include text content (e.g., the testimonial message), the name of the person, and their title or affiliation. The design should be clean and minimal, using arrows or buttons for navigation. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **TestimonialCard (Standalone)**: Displays a single testimonial including the message, person's name, and title. - **CarouselControls (Standalone)**: Provides buttons or arrows to navigate through the testimonials. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **TestimonialCard**: ```html
{testimonial_text}

{person_name}

{person_title}

``` - **CarouselControls**: ```html
```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should consist of a simple, clean layout featuring a section for post editing with a text area and a section below or beside it (depending on the screen size) for formatting tools like buttons for bold, italic, underline, and list creation. This should be mobile responsive, adjusting the layout based on the device size. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **TextAreaEditor** (Standalone): A text input area where users can type in their posts. - **FormattingToolbar** (Standalone): A toolbar containing buttons for applying various text formats like bold, italic, underline, and list options. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **TextAreaEditor**: ```html
``` - **FormattingToolbar**: ```html
```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should display an article content area comprising a title, optional subtitle, the main body text, and an optional author byline. This should be formatted to enhance readability and engagement, with the title prominent at the top, followed by the subtitle (if present), the body text, and finally the author byline at the bottom. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **ArticleContainer (Standalone)**: Wraps the entire content of the article including title, subtitle, body, and byline for styling and layout purposes. - **ArticleTitle (Standalone)**: Displays the article's title. - **ArticleSubtitle (Standalone)**: Displays the article's subtitle, which is optional. - **ArticleBody (Standalone)**: Contains the main textual content of the article. - **ArticleByline (Standalone)**: Shows the author's name and other publication details, optionally. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html ``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **ArticleContainer**: ```html
{children}
``` - **ArticleTitle**: ```html

{title}

``` - **ArticleSubtitle**: ```html

{subtitle}

``` - **ArticleBody**: ```html
{body_text}
``` - **ArticleByline**: ```html

{author}

```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should consist of a slider component that users can interact with to select a value within a specified range. The slider should have a track that fills as the handle is moved, visually indicating the value selected. It should be visually clear and accessible, with labels or tooltips displaying the current value for better user understanding. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **SliderComponent**: Standalone component - **SliderLabel**: Standalone component that displays the label and the current value of the slider. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **SliderLabel**: ```html
{slider_value}
``` - **SliderComponent**: ```html ```

prompt: User settings panel with notification and account options

message.content:
1) **What should the UI look like?** The User Settings Panel should appear as a sidebar or a modal that includes sections for both notification settings and account options. It would typically feature toggles for notification preferences and a section for managing account details like password changes or personal information updates. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **SettingsPanel (Standalone)**: This is the main container for the settings UI. - **SettingsHeader (Standalone)**: Displays the title of the settings panel. - **SettingsSection (Takes children)**: Used for grouping related setting items. - **SettingsItem (Takes children)**: Individual setting options like toggles or input fields. - **ToggleButton (Takes children)**: A toggle element to enable or disable settings. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html

Notification Settings

Account Options
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **SettingsPanel**: ```html
{children}
``` - **SettingsHeader**: ```html

User Settings

``` - **SettingsSection**: ```html
{children}
``` - **SettingsItem**: ```html
{children}
``` - **ToggleButton**: ```html ```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should consist of a set of control elements to manage transitions, typical in multimedia applications. These controls typically include buttons for playing, pausing, stopping, and maybe sliders for controlling transition progress or speed. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **PlayButton** (standalone): A button to start a transition. - **PauseButton** (standalone): A button to pause the ongoing transition. - **StopButton** (standalone): A button to stop the transition. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **PlayButton:** ```html ``` - **PauseButton:** ```html ``` - **StopButton:** ```html ```

1) What should the UI look like? - The UI should feature a list of items displayed in a grid or list format. Below the list, there should be a pagination control consisting of previous, next, and numbered page buttons to navigate through pages. Alternatively, an infinite scroll mechanism can load more items automatically as the user scrolls down. 2) What are the individual components that make up the UI? - **GridDisplay** (Standalone): A component that displays items in a grid format. - **ListDisplay** (Standalone): A component that displays items in a list format. - **PaginationControl** (Standalone): A component containing navigation buttons for paging through items. 3) What does the HTML for the UI look like? ```html
``` 4) What is the HTML for each component? - **GridDisplay**: ```html
{itemContent}
``` - **ListDisplay**: ```html
  • {itemContent}
``` - **PaginationControl**: ```html
```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should include an alert notification that communicates a warning to users. The alert will typically be highlighted with colors that designate caution, such as yellow or orange, and contain a clear and concise message. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **AlertBox (Standalone)**: This is the container for the alert message. It is styled to draw attention and indicate the warning status. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **AlertBox** ```html

{warningMessage}

```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The sign-in form should be simple and user-friendly, featuring a username/email and password field, a sign-in button, and optionally, a "Forgot Password?" link. It should be centered on the page and responsive across different devices. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **SignInForm (Standalone)**: This is the main container that holds all other components. - **FormInput (Standalone)**: A reusable input component for entering data such as username/email and password. - **SubmitButton (Standalone)**: A button for submitting the form. - **ForgotPasswordLink (Standalone)**: An optional link for users who need to reset their password. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **SignInForm**: ```html
``` - **FormInput**: ```html ``` - **SubmitButton**: ```html ``` - **ForgotPasswordLink**: ```html Forgot Password? ```

prompt: Text or icon that, when clicked, navigates to another page or resource

message.content:
1) What should the UI look like? - A simple clickable text or icon that serves as a hyperlink. This should be visually distinct enough to indicate that it's interactive, such as a different color, underline, or accompanied by an icon. 2) What are the individual components that make up the UI? - **LinkButton**: Standalone component. This component renders a clickable element which can be text or an icon wrapped in an anchor (``) tag. 3) What does the HTML for the UI look like? ```html
``` 4) What is the HTML for each component? - **LinkButton**: ```html {link_text} ``` Use `{target_url}` to provide the destination URL and `{link_text}` for the display text of the link.
